image.altText: A man with a beard smiles.

props.synopsis: A man standing trial for the murder of 38-year-old Steven Murphy allegedly watched his victim die before dragging his body into a two-metre pit.

title.children: Man allegedly watched victim 'writhe' after shooting him four times

image.altText: Mavro, a black dog who is blind, has his head turned to the side and his mouth open.

props.synopsis: When Amy van Dyk noticed her pooch Mavro was 'running into things', she thought he was simply a clumsy puppy. She soon discovered he had a vision impairment — but that hasn't stopped Mavro from hiking, swimming and dog sledding.

title.children: From hiking to sledding, blind dog Mavro 'just keeps going'

image.altText: Nine players in whites and red caps hug and celebrate on a green field.

props.synopsis: South Australia currently sits on top of both the first-class and one-day competitions as it returns from the international break.

title.children: SA is in prime position to break 29-year Sheffield Shield drought

image.altText: A man holding two bunches of grapes in a vineyard in front of a tractor.

props.synopsis: Drought, heat and frost have cut yields and pushed SA's wine industry into an early vintage, but a silver lining looms in the promise of high quality wines as a result.

title.children: SA vintage kicks off early but shows promise of excellent wine

image.altText: Two Australian wheelchair rugby players sit on court in their chairs, smiling and holding an Australian flag behind them.

props.synopsis: Australia's Steelers are coming home to host the inaugural Wheelchair Rugby World Challenge in Adelaide.

title.children: Australia to host new global wheelchair rugby tournament in Adelaide

image.altText: A sign promotes the hydrogen plant.

props.synopsis: The SA government's $600 million hydrogen plant proposal has been plunged into doubt, with the premier indicating the money could be spent elsewhere in Whyalla if the owner of the city's steelworks does not invest in upgrading the site.

title.children: Hydrogen plant in doubt as SA premier refuses to commit to $600m project

image.altText: A street post with one way pointing to 'Historic Way' and the other way pointing to 'Offensive Place'

props.synopsis: Places and their names can hold different meanings for different people, but what happens when those in a community are uncomfortable with a historical figure or the association a place is named after?

title.children: Hundreds of places in Australia contain this 'racist slur' that experts want changed

image.altText: An early morning drone shot of a hill with underground homes built into it at White Cliffs, in outback NSW.

props.synopsis: Locals and first responders are being supported following the death of a boy on a remote property in Far West New South Wales.

title.children: Teen driver released from hospital after 9yo's death in ute rollover

image.altText: An aerial shot of pine forestry plantations.

props.synopsis: A plan to build more than 100 wind turbines in pine plantations close to a unique wetland in south-west Victoria is out for public comment.

title.children: $1.2b wind farm plan for plantations near Ramsar-listed wetland

image.altText: person hauls a car along an iced road in the snow

props.synopsis: Adelaide's Aaron Crook is the sole Australian among 11 global competitors who will race each other 620 kilometres in temperatures as low as -50 degrees Celsius across the Arctic Circle.

title.children: Athlete ready to risk Arctic frostbite in 'hardest, most epic' race yet

image.altText: Four-year-old Chloe Valentine, who died in January 2012.

props.synopsis: Prominent child protection advocate Belinda Valentine has urged the South Australian government to rethink proposed law reforms, saying it's a "missed opportunity" to prevent further tragedies.

title.children: Child protection advocate urges SA government to rethink law reform

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: A defence lawyer has told a court that the evidence of a key witness in a criminal neglect trial against father Ashley McGregor was "simply unbelievable".

title.children: Key witness in criminal neglect trial against SA father 'simply unbelievable', court hears

image.altText: An aerial photo of a large estate on large well-kept lawns, overlooking a marina with docked boats on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Several towns across South Australia will be part of a trial run by the state's electricity distributor to install batteries that it hopes will improve the grid's reliability, increase renewable energy use, and increase the speed at which electric vehicles can be charged.

title.children: Community battery trial a 'win-win-win' for small towns on end of powerline

image.altText: Aerial photo of end of island with aqua ocean rocky edge

props.synopsis: South Australia's fourth-largest island is set to become an ark for mammal species recovery, funded by $4.8 million from governments including ridding the island of rats, mice, and cats.

title.children: $4.8 million pledged to return island to the wild to save threatened species

image.altText: A woman walks wearing a black coat next to a man wearing a black puffer jacket looking toward something out of frame

props.synopsis: Ms Kerr took to the witness box for the first time in her high-profile trial, where she faces one charge of racially aggravated harassment of a London police officer.

title.children: Sam Kerr told she has 'miraculous' memory under intense cross-examination at trial

image.altText: A photo of a Chinese-Australian man Yang Hengjun, sitting on an outside table, wearing a navy polo shirt with a red collar.

props.synopsis: Foreign minister Penny Wong said the Australian Government has "serious concerns" for the health of Chinese-Australian writer Yang Hengjun jailed in China.

title.children: Foreign minister voices 'serious concerns' for Australian writer jailed in China

image.altText: A dark silhouette of a hand holding a mobile phone showing a purple DeepSeek logo and loading screen in front of a Chinese flag

props.synopsis: In a statement from the Chinese foreign ministry, the move by the Australian federal government was described as the 'politicisation of economic, trade and technological issues'.

title.children: China slams Australia's DeepSeek ban on government devices

image.altText: NSW Attorney General Michael Daley speaks to the media

props.synopsis: The Minns government has proposed law changes to respond to the wave of racist acts across the state, including giving officers more powers, despite the recommendations of a nine-month review published last year.

title.children: NSW introduces hate speech law changes despite review recommendation

image.altText: A close-up of Jim Chalmers's face.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers has told business chiefs to turn away from "culture" wars and help Labor rebuild the economy after the inflation crisis.

title.children: Treasurer enlists big business to spur the post-inflation economic recovery

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding a phone. It is superimposed on a drawing of Australia and surrounded by social media apps.

props.synopsis: Often called digital natives, most young Australians use multiple social media platforms. But in the wake of some big changes to platforms like Meta and X, are their attitudes changing?

title.children: Are young Australians losing trust in social media?

image.altText: Jillian Segal

props.synopsis: Australia was "on everyone's lips … for all the wrong reasons" at the International Holocaust Remembrance Day event in Auschwitz last week, the nation's antisemitism envoy Jillian Segal says.

title.children: Australia 'on everyone's lips' at international Holocaust event in Auschwitz, envoy says

image.altText: Philippine Vice-President Sara Duterte attends a legislative inquiry into her office's use of public funds

props.synopsis: Philippine Vice-President Sara Duterte has been impeached by lawmakers after a vote in the House of Representatives, paving the way for a Senate trial that could see her removed from office.

title.children: Philippine Vice-President Sara Duterte impeached over 'assassination plot'

image.altText: The king and queen, wearing black, laying flowers on the ground outside a school.

props.synopsis: Eleven people were killed when a gunman opened fire on Tuesday in what was the country's worst ever mass shooting.

title.children: 'Traumatic event': Swedish king and queen join mourners at mass shooting scene

image.altText: Police officers investigating a crime scene at a Kingswood pizza shop at night.

props.synopsis: Seven teenagers are in custody after a 58-year-old man was fatally stabbed at his Kingswood pizza shop on Tuesday night.

title.children: Seven teenagers arrested after Sydney pizza shop owner fatally stabbed

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: a skyline with houses

props.synopsis: There could soon be relief for households with a mortgage, with economists predicting an interest rate cut when the Reserve Bank board meets in February. If rates do fall, it will be the first time since 2020. So, what could it mean for your repayments?

title.children: The RBA meets later this month. This is what the experts are predicting will happen

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaking at a podium.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has praised the states and territories for being tough on crime in the first weeks of his unofficial election campaign.

title.children: Dutton has borrowed a campaign tactic from Nixon's playbook — but will it work?

image.altText: Close up of ABC managing director David Anderson speaks during a Senate Committee hearing at Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: ABC managing director David Anderson says the process surrounding the decision to remove Antoinette Lattouf from her role presenting on ABC Radio Sydney should have been handled differently.

title.children: ABC managing director says 'step missing' in removal of Lattouf

image.altText: Trump purses his lips in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Donald Trump was a fierce critic of America's wars in Iraq and Afghanistan — yet today, there he was, promising a new American excursion into the Middle East with the potential to spark disaster on a similar scale.

title.children: Trump's Gaza plan has the potential to spark disaster on a huge scale

image.altText: An old black and white photo of yachts sailing on a river

props.synopsis: It is believed about 26 Derwent-class yachts were built in their heyday, but several are still unaccounted-for. The largest contingent of the historic boats will race at this weekend's Australian Wooden Boat Festival.

title.children: Many of these old yachts are still lost, can you help find them?

image.altText: Steve Smith holds his bat in his baggy green

props.synopsis: Steve Smith could remain in the hot seat as Australian captain with Pat Cummins "hugely unlikely" to play in the Champions Trophy.

title.children: Smith in box seat to retain captaincy for Champions Trophy

image.altText: Adam hunter holds his finger up to celebrate during an AFL game for the West Coast Eagles.

props.synopsis: Former West Coast Eagles player Adam Hunter is found dead in his hometown of Bunbury aged 43, the latest death to rock the AFL community this week.

title.children: Another death shocks AFL as premiership Eagle Adam Hunter dies aged 43

image.altText: Passengers wait for delayed trains at Central Station in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The combined rail unions have announced two weeks of industrial action from Wednesday week due to the government's refusal to refund train fares to passengers impacted by last month's train disruptions, who are instead offering a free fare day.

title.children: Rail workers plan more industrial action as commuters offered 'fare free day'

image.altText: Basil Zempilas speaks while holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: Perth Lord Mayor-turned star Liberal candidate Basil Zempilas is ordered to apologise for blurring the line between the two positions, but will refer a leak of the decision to the corruption watchdog.

title.children: Liberal candidate Zempilas ordered to apologise for act breach, raises CCC concerns

image.altText: Holly McNamara celebrates

props.synopsis: Melbourne City have smashed Western United 5-1, with star attacker Holly McNamara scoring a hat-trick after her Matildas recall following a third ACL injury and more than 12 months out the game.

title.children: City striker celebrates Matildas recall after ACL injury with hat-trick
